intro: Endlicheria coriacea, commonly known as the rough-stemmed endlicheria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
